intro: Oreomunnea, commonly known as the "crown-of-thorns" or "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. Oreomunnea species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. They often grow in moist, shaded environments and are known for their ability to thrive in humid climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant flower colors.
